body: Brown surpasses Gov. Earl Warren's 10-year tenure.
title: Brown sets a record by becoming the longest-serving governor in the state of California.
caption: California Gov. Jerry Brown speaks during the Drive The Dream event at the Exploratorium on September 16, 2013 in San Francisco, California. Credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

body: Brown signs AB1121, a bill that would make it easier for transgender Californians to change their name and gender on birth certificates.
title: Transgender birth certificate legislation approved
caption: A converted U.S. flag displays rainbow colors as people relax on the grass after the fourth annual national march for gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender rights April 30, 2000 on the mall in Washington, DC. Credit: Michael Smith/Getty Images

body: Brown delivers his first inaugural address as the 34th governor of the state of California, succeeding Ronald Reagan.
title: Brown officially sworn in as governor of the state of California

body: Gov. Brown's vetoes included further restrictions on semi-automatic weapons proposed by fellow Democrat Darrell Steinberg, but he signed a ban on lead ammunition used by hunters.
title: 7 major gun bills vetoed, 11 signed

body: "Brown signs AB131, a bill allowing students who are on the path to citizenship with the opportunity to apply for college financial aid at community colleges and universities."
title: California Dream Act signed
caption: Undocumented students and their supporters were vocal in their call for legislation to support their cause at the state and federal level. Credit: Nataly Tavidian/KPCC

body: California becomes the first state to directly address discrimination against transgender public school students under AB 1266.
title: California becomes the first state to protect transgender students from discrimination
caption: Lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Californians lauded the new state law. Credit: Shirley Jahad/KPCC

body: Brpwn supports a major push to shift inmates from state prisons to county jails in an effort to meet a federal court order to reduce overcrowding.
title: Shifting inmates from state prisons to local jails
caption: Local law enforcement officials, including L.A. County Sheriff Lee Baca, express concern about the effects of realignment. Credit: Associated Press

body: Educators laud the passing of funding legislation designed to assist disadvantaged children and assess local control on budget spending. The legislation replaces a previous complex finance system for K-12 schools.
title: Brown signs legislation to assist 'neediest students' and restore local control on school spending
caption: Gov. Jerry Brown signs legislation during a ceremony at Cahuenga Elementary School in Los Angeles on July 1, 2013.

body: Gov. Brown approved all but about 11% of the nearly 900 bills sent to him by the legislature — the fewest he's rejected since retaking office.
title: The final count on 2013's bills

body: Brown proposes a 'budget-free deficit' as a result of California's unstable financial conditions and tax increases.
title: Deficit-free budget proposed

body: Brown defends his proposal to close 400 municipal redevelopment agencies in order to help address the state's budget crisis.
title: Proposal to shut down local redevelopment agencies to save $1.7 billion

body: Gov. Brown signs a law which gives minors the option to delete or remove the information they post on the Internet.
title: Brown signs the "eraser button" law
caption: A teenager and his younger brother enjoy trading insults over an instant messaging system. Credit: AFP/Getty Images

body: Brown signs a bill that would prohibit the LAPD and other law enforcement officials from detaining immigrants for minor crimes.
title: Trust Act signed; victory for immigrants

body: Chancellor Robert Birgeneau recognizes Brown for sustaining the Cal Grant program for low-income students, and two bills that comprised the California Dream Act, among various other pieces of legislation granting financial aid to undocumented students.
title: Jerry brown delivers commencement address at UC Berkeley
caption: At UC Berkeley, students gathered to thank California Governor Jerry Brown for signing into law AB131, which will allow illegal immigrants to participate in state funded financial aid programs. Credit: Ben Margot/AP

body: Under Brown's push for Prop 30, income taxes are raised for the wealthiest Californians, followed by a temporary state sales tax increase for K-12 funding, colleges and universities.
title: Prop 30 passes
caption: Gov. Jerry Brown campaigned relentlessly for the passage of Proposition 30. Credit: Julie Small/KPCC

body: A controversial pilot program aimed at increasing the cost of classes per unit at community colleges is "okayed" by Brown, but criticized by community college chancellor Brice Harris.
title: Creating a two-tier fee structure for community colleges
caption: Pasadena Community College in Pasadena, Calif. Credit: prayitno/Flickr

body: California becomes the tenth state to allow undocumented immigrants the chance to apply for a driver's license.
title: Law allows undocumented immigrants to receive driver's licenses
caption: Gov. Brown signed AB 60, allowing undocumented immigrants to legally apply for driver's licenses by 2015. Credit: David McNew/Getty Images

body: Gov. Brown signs AB 240,  which forces three private water companies that serve the small city to comply with open-meeting and record rules that apply to public agencies.
title: Cleaning up Maywood's water politics
caption: Maywood resident Robert Taylor holds up a bottle filled with tap water from his kitchen sink. Credit: Maya Sugarman/KPCC

body: California pilots a new, computerized test as part of transition to Common Core. Federal officials have threatened to fine the state over testing limits.
title: Adopting Common Core standards, doing away with standardized testing
caption: Governor Jerry Brown signed a bill that officially puts an end to the state's multiple-choice standardized test. Credit: Max Whittaker/Getty Images

body: Brown wins the governor's race against former eBay president Meg Whitman. He is officially sworn in as governor on January 3, 2011, inheriting a $28 billion budget deficit.
title: Brown elected to third-term
caption: Jerry Brown after his inauguration as governor, Jan. 3, 2011. Credit: Julie Small/KPCC

body: Brown receives criticism for "authorizing the removal of as many as 11 top city officials, including Oakland's first African-American police chief" during his time as mayor.
title: Sworn in as the mayor of Oakland
caption: California Gov. Jerry Brown speaks during the Drive The Dream event at the Exploratorium on September 16, 2013 in San Francisco, California. Credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

body: Brown takes an 18-point victory - greater than that of any other candidate for statewide office.
title: Brown elected as California's 31st attorney general

body: Brown is re-elected to a second term by a margin of 21% over Republican Attorney General Evelle J. Younger. He decides not to run for re-election and is succeeded in 1983 by Republican George Deukmejian.
title: Re-elected to second term
caption: Jerry Brown in 1980 with his father Edmund G. "Pat" Brown, right, a former California governor. Credit: Associated Press
